claim: The SME customer who consumed the least in June 2012 operates primarily in the aviation sector.
reasoning: The claim references the 'aviation sector' as the industry in which a customer operates, but the database contains no information about customer industry sectors. The customers table only has Segment (SME/LAM/KAM) and Currency columns. There is no column or table in the schema that tracks what industry or sector a customer operates in, making this an OUT-OF-SCHEMA claim.

content.text: I'll start by exploring the database schema to understand what data is available.

input.description: List all tables in the database
Get full schema of the database

content.content:
CREATE TABLE customers
(
    CustomerID INTEGER UNIQUE     not null
        primary key,
    Segment    TEXT null,
    Currency   TEXT null
);
CREATE TABLE gasstations
(
    GasStationID INTEGER    UNIQUE   not null
        primary key,
    ChainID      INTEGER          null,
    Country      TEXT null,
    Segment      TEXT null
);
CREATE TABLE products
(
    ProductID   INTEGER   UNIQUE      not null
        primary key,
    Description TEXT null
);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "transactions_1k"
(
    TransactionID INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,
    Date          DATE,
    Time          TEXT,
    CustomerID    INTEGER,
    CardID        INTEGER,
    GasStationID  INTEGER,
    ProductID     INTEGER,
    Amount        INTEGER,
    Price         REAL
);
CREATE TABLE sqlite_sequence(name,seq);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "yearmonth"
(
    CustomerID  INTEGER not null
        references customers
            on update cascade on delete cascade
        references customers,
    Date        TEXT    not null,
    Consumption REAL,
    primary key (Date, CustomerID)
);

(
    CustomerID INTEGER UNIQUE     not null
        primary key,
    Segment    TEXT null,

        primary key autoincrement,
    Date          DATE,
    Time          TEXT,
    CustomerID    INTEGER,
    CardID        INTEGER,
    GasStationID  INTEGER,
    ProductID     INTEGER,
    Amount        INTEGER,
    Price         REAL
);
CREATE TABLE sqlite_sequence(name,seq);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "yearmonth"
(
    CustomerID  INTEGER not null
        references customers
            on update cascade on delete cascade
        references customers,
    Date        TEXT    not null,
    Consumption REAL,
    primary key (Date, CustomerID)
);

1. SME customer segment
2. Least consumption in June 2012 (yearmonth.Date = '201206')
3. "Aviation sector" - I need to check if this concept exists in the database.

content.text:
The claim mentions "aviation sector." There's no column in any table that refers to an industry sector or "aviation." The `customers` table only has `Segment` (SME/LAM/KAM) and `Currency`. The `gasstations` table has a `Segment` but it refers to gas station categories (Value for money, Premium, etc.), not industry sectors. There's no "aviation" concept anywhere in the schema.

Let me also verify there's no other column or table that could relate to "aviation sector":

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/debit_card_specializing.sqlite" "SELECT DISTINCT Description FROM products LIMIT 30;"
